title: Woman recounts alleged Trump sex assault during civil rape trial
description: Jessica Leeds says she was sexually assaulted by Trump years before he allegedly raped writer E Jean Carroll.

title: Senator urges release of new US report on killing of Abu Akleh
description: The Biden administration has not acknowledged a new assessment on Israel's fatal shooting of Al Jazeera journalist.

title: Israel bombs Gaza as tensions rise over death of Khader Adnan
description: Israel is striking Gaza after Palestinian factions sent rockets across the border following the death of Khader Adnan.

title: Calls for ceasefire at start of latest Colombia-ELN peace talks
description: Peace talks between the rebel group and the Colombian government have entered their third round of negotiations in Cuba.

title: Blast causes another train to derail in Russia near Ukraine
description: A blast derailed a freight train in a Russian region near Ukraine, authorities say, adding there were no casualties.

title: India’s Go First airline files for bankruptcy
description: The airline blamed 'faulty' Pratt & Whitney engines which led to the grounding of half its fleet, hurting revenue.

title: Brazil’s ‘fake news’ bill sparks outcry from tech giants
description: Major tech companies are campaigning against legislation, prompting backlash from Brazilian justice minister and courts.

title: US short-seller says iconic investor Icahn has ‘ponzi-like’ biz
description: Hindenburg Research said Carl Icahn takes money from new investors 'to pay out dividends to old investors'.

title: Greece’s top court bans far-right party from May election
description: The Greeks (Hellenes) Party is the first party to be disqualified since the restoration of democracy in 1974.

title: How much of a threat is Sudan’s conflict to Chad?
description: Chad was already hosting hundreds of thousands of Sudanese refugees before the latest fighting.

title: US lawmakers hold hearing on Supreme Court ethics concerns
description: The hearing comes in the wake of several reports detailing failure by justices to report possible conflicts of interest.

title: Biden administration sending 1,500 more soldiers to Mexico border
description: Troops will assist with administrative duties as US prepares for end of contentious Title 42 border restriction.

title: UN chief says ‘not the right time’ to engage with Taliban
description: The UN head says he would hold similar meetings in the future after Doha meeting ended without acknowledging Taliban.

title: Sudan’s warring sides ‘agree seven-day ceasefire’
description: South Sudan's foreign ministry, which made the announcement, say the truce will start from Thursday.

title: ‘Another era’: As King Charles III takes crown, Canada shrugs
description: Coronation met with 'ambivalence' in largest Commonwealth nation, experts say, as calls to break with UK monarchy grow.

title: The UN must not adopt the IHRA definition
description: This would be detrimental not only to United Nations agencies, but also to the global human rights regime.

title: Detained by Russian occupiers: ‘They jail you and forget’
description: Liliya Pshenichnaya says Russian forces held her for 60 days in a process that was arbitrary, frightful, and confused.

title: Indians jailed for spying on Qatar for Israel: Reports
description: Eight Indian nationals are accused of passing along information about a stealth-capable submarine, say media reports.

title: Arrests, hunger strikes, protests – the life of Khader Adnan
description: A timeline of major events in the life of Palestinian prisoner Khader Adnan, who died in Israeli detention.

title: Former US officer found guilty of aiding in George Floyd killing
description: US judge finds ex-Minneapolis police officer Tou Thao guilty of aiding and abetting in Floyd's May 2020 killing.

title: Int’l condolences after Palestinian prisoner Khader Adnan’s death
description: The ICRC called on Israel to release Palestinian hunger striker Adnan's body to allow his family to mourn.

title: Climate talks see push for deadline on ending ‘fossil fuel age’
description: Calls grow to set a deadline for phasing out all fossil fuels at Berlin climate conference.

title: Photos: Protests in Palestine after the death of Khader Adnan
description: A general strike closes shops, and hundreds of people demonstrate in honour of hunger striker.

title: Eurozone inflation rises to 7 percent after months of decline
description: Food, drink and energy prices keep climbing across the single currency area following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Hollywood writers go on strike: Here is what to know
description: The Writers Guild of America says it supports a work stoppage after failing to reach an agreement for higher pay.

title: Kosovo, Serbia leaders resume talks in Brussels to normalise ties
description: After more than a decade of negotiations, EU wants Balkan neighbours to settle on plan and put hostilities to rest.

title: Who was Khader Adnan, the Palestinian who died on hunger strike?
description: Khader Adnan, a spokesperson for the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, has died after a nearly three-month-long hunger strike.

title: IBA slams ‘black sheep’ breakaway body as schism roils boxing
description: A new world boxing federation was announced last month in a move aimed at securing the troubled sport's Olympic future.

title: How to ignore Israel’s apartheid: Learn from Ursula von der Leyen
description: The EU boss should be ashamed about her use of anti-Palestinian racist tropes. She won't be.

title: Canada’s folk singer-songwriter Gordon Lightfoot dies aged 84
description: One of the most renowned voices to emerge from the folk scene of the 1960s, Lightfoot recorded 20 studio albums.

title: Australia to ban recreational vaping in ‘Big Tobacco’ crackdown
description: In recent years, Australia has struggled to contain the explosion in recreational vaping, particularly among teens.

title: FIFA threatens Europe with Women’s World Cup broadcast blackout
description: Gianni Infantino says rights offers from 'Big 5' European countries are unacceptable and a 'slap in the face'.
